thread.title: Top-seeded Bishops take care of Crusaders
thread.title_full: Top-seeded Bishops take care of Crusaders

title: Top-seeded Bishops take care of Crusaders
text:
Top-seeded Bishops take care of Crusaders Brandon Hannahs , Reporter 10:05 p.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Buy Photo Rosecrans' Carter Hagy and Steubenville Catholic Central's Jacob Rigaud battle for possession during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Lane Dailey celebrates with teammates Michael Gibson and Jared Shaffer after scoring his third goal in a 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over Steubenville Catholic Central on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Carter Hagy prepares to kick the ball down field during a 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over Steubenville Catholic Central on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Joseph Goggin and Steubinville Catholic Central's Mikey Irvin battle for possession during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Keagan McLaughlin clears the ball away during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over Steubenville Catholic Central on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Carter Hagy kicks the ball away from Steubenville Central Catholic's Brady Bolder during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Steubenville Catholic Central's Joey Schlich heads a ball away from Rosecrans' Wyatt Lang during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Jared Shaffer and Steubenville Catholic Central's Mikey Irvin battle for possession during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Aaron Gehlken throws the ball in bounds during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over Steubenville Catholic Central on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Andrew Nash battles for possession with Steubenville Catholic Central's Kevin Herrmann and Joe Zinno during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Jared Shaffer and Steubenville Catholic Central's Kevin Herrmann battle for possession during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Steubenville Catholic Central's Joe Zinno battles for possession with Rosecrans' Andrew Nash and Carter Hagy during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Jared Shaffer and Andrew Nash battle for possession with Steubenville Catholic Central's Jacob Rigaud during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Fullscreen Buy Photo Rosecrans' Aaron Gehlken kicks the ball during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over Steubenville Catholic Central on Saturday in Zanesville. Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Rosecrans' Carter Hagy and Steubenville Catholic Central's Jacob Rigaud battle for possession during the Bishops 5-1 Division III sectional finals win over the Crusaders on Saturday in Zanesville. (Photo: Shane Flanigan/Times Recorder) 50 CONNECT 9 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ZANESVILLE - The Rosecrans offense has been slowed by few opponents this season. 
Second seed Steubenville Catholic Central found out firsthand how tough that chore was. 
The top-seeded Bishops scored three first-half goals en route to a 5-1 victory in the Division III sectional final Saturday at Rosecrans High School. 
Rosecrans (14-2-2) advances to face third seed Berlin Hiland, which defeated Tuscarawas Valley 9-0 in the other sectional final. They play at 6:30 p.m. Tuesday at Kenny Wolford Park in Dresden. 
Lane Dailey led the offense with a hat trick, while Joe Goggin and Carter Hagy also scored in the victory. 
Controlling possession and executing set pieces led to multiple opportunities for Rosecrans, which outshot the Crusaders 18-3. 
Rosecrans coach Rod Gibson said he felt the offense rebounded after a sluggish performance in a 3-0 win over Richmond Edison on Monday. 
"With their record, we knew it wouldn't be an easy game. They have some quality players on that side," he said. "We didn't play well against Edison, but it was different today. We were able to pressure them high and stay on the attack." 
It took Rosecrans less than five minutes to get on the board. Hagy's free kick bounced out of the hands of Crusaders keeper Austin Fowkes, allowing Goggin to knock home the rebound at the 35:38 mark. 
Allowing that goal put the Crusaders (14-2-2) in a tough position, said SCC coach Steve Kopcha. 
"It was uncharacteristic of us to give up those early goals," he said. "You give any team momentum like that, it's tough to overcome. We knew we had time to rebound, but with their defense and keeper, we didn't have a lot of chances. 
"Our execution wasn't what it has been all season," he added. "I wished we could have played today the way we have all season." 
The Bishops continued to keep pressure on the Crusader defense, and Dailey took advantage, scoring his first goal about 12 minutes later on an assist from Riley Kanavel. 
Another set piece led to the 3-0 advantage. Aaron Gehlken's throw-in near the corner found Hagy, who headed the ball into the back of the net with less than 10 minutes remaining in the first half. 
"We executed our pieces and took what was there," Gibson said. "We were able to outplay the weather and some calls that went against us. You have to credit our kids for staying focused." 
Dailey got loose again about nine minutes into the second half, hitting a goal from a tough angle past Fowkes for a 4-0 lead. 
Kevin Herrmann put the Crusaders on the board, converting a penalty kick at the 15:42 mark, but three minutes, Michael Gibson hit a pass across the box, and Dailey finished to cap his hat trick and the scoring. 
Rosecrans keeper Keagen McLaughlin finished with two saves, while Fowkes made 13 stops in the losing effort. 
bhannahs@zanesvilletimesrecorder.com
